text: Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Move fast and break things. Unless you are breaking stuff, you are not moving fast enough.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.
author: Chris Grosser

text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Don’t count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Hard choices, easy life. Easy choices, hard life.
author: Jerzy Gregorek

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: Action is the foundational key to all success.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings

text: It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

text: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
author: Charles Dickens, A Tale of Two Cities

text: So it goes.
author: Kurt Vonnegut, Slaughterhouse-Five

text: Big Brother is watching you.
author: George Orwell, 1984

text: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

text: There is some good in this world, and it’s worth fighting for.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Two Towers

text: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.
author: George Orwell, Animal Farm

text: We accept the love we think we deserve.
author: Stephen Chbosky, The Perks of Being a Wallflower

text: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
author: Emily Brontë, Wuthering Heights

text: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.
author: Mary Shelley, Frankenstein

text: The man in black fled across the desert, and the gunslinger followed.
author: Stephen King, The Gunslinger

text: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.
author: Harper Lee, To Kill a Mockingbird

text: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King, The Shawshank Redemption

text: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice

text: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.
author: William Shakespeare, The Tempest

text: The only limits for tomorrow are the doubts we have today.
author: Pittacus Lore, I Am Number Four

text: Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart.
author: Haruki Murakami, Kafka on the Shore

text: Man is not truly one, but truly two.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson, Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde

text: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
author: Zora Neale Hurston, Their Eyes Were Watching God

text: I am haunted by humans.
author: Markus Zusak, The Book Thief

text: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, The Little Prince

text: Call me Ishmael.
author: Herman Melville, Moby-Dick

text: Time is a slippery thing: lose hold of it once, and its string might sail out of your hands forever.
author: Anthony Doerr, All the Light We Cannot See

text: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
author: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

text: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
author: Stephen King, The Shining

text: I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart: I am, I am, I am.
author: Sylvia Plath, The Bell Jar

text: To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.
author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone

text: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
author: Haruki Murakami, What I Talk About When I Talk About Running

text: Brave doesn’t mean you’re not scared. It means you go on even though you’re scared.
author: Angie Thomas, The Hate U Give
